toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# ULTRATHINK ZFS-NATIVE BUILD SYSTEM
# Builds on ZFS dataset with snapshots, creates ZFS-based live environment
# Uses ZFS send/receive instead of squashfs for ultimate performance
# Debian Trixie base with full ZFS 2.3.x integration

set -euo pipefail

# Terminal colors (must be before logging functions)
readonly RED='\033[0;31m'
readonly GREEN='\033[0;32m'
readonly YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
readonly BLUE='\033[0;34m'
readonly CYAN='\033[0;36m'
readonly MAGENTA='\033[0;35m'
readonly WHITE='\033[1;37m'
readonly NC='\033[0m'
readonly BOLD='\033[1m'

# Early logging functions (before LOG_FILE is set, output to stderr)
log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $*" >&2
}

log_info() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}[INFO]${NC} $*" >&2
}

# Error handler (needs log_error)
error_handler() {
    local line_no=$1
    local exit_code=$2
    log_error "Error on line $line_no with exit code $exit_code"
    log_error "Cleaning up after failure..."
    if declare -f cleanup >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        cleanup
    fi
    exit $exit_code
}

trap 'error_handler ${LINENO} $?' ERR

# Build configuration
readonly BUILD_TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)
readonly ISO_NAME="ultrathink-zfs-native-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}.iso"
readonly OUTPUT_DIR="$(pwd)/output"
readonly LOGS_DIR="$(pwd)/logs"
readonly LOG_FILE="${LOGS_DIR}/build-zfs-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}.log"
readonly BUILD_LOG="${LOGS_DIR}/build-modules-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}.log"

# Create directories early for logging
mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR" "$LOGS_DIR"

# Dracut configuration (superior to initramfs-tools)
readonly USE_DRACUT="${USE_DRACUT:-true}"  # Use dracut for better hardware support
readonly TARGET_FILESYSTEM="${TARGET_FILESYSTEM:-zfs}"  # Target filesystem (zfs/ext4/btrfs/xfs)

# ZFS configuration - HARDCODED SAFETY: NEVER touch system pools
readonly FORBIDDEN_POOLS=("rpool" "bpool" "tank" "data" "system" "root")
readonly ZFS_POOL="buildpool"  # HARDCODED - ONLY use buildpool, NEVER anything else
readonly ZFS_BUILD_BASE="${ZFS_POOL}/livecd-builds"
readonly ZFS_BUILD_DATASET="${ZFS_BUILD_BASE}/build-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}"
readonly ZFS_MOUNT="/mnt/zfs-build-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}"

# Safety check - ABORT if trying to use forbidden pool
for forbidden in "${FORBIDDEN_POOLS[@]}"; do
    if [ "$ZFS_POOL" = "$forbidden" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}CRITICAL ERROR: Attempting to use system pool '$forbidden'${NC}"
        echo -e "${RED}This script is HARDCODED to only use 'buildpool'${NC}"
        echo -e "${RED}ABORTING for safety${NC}"
        exit 99
    fi
done

# Work directories on ZFS
readonly WORK_DIR="${ZFS_MOUNT}"
readonly CHROOT_DIR="${WORK_DIR}/chroot"
readonly IMAGE_DIR="${WORK_DIR}/image"

# Source configuration
readonly SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "$0")" && pwd)"
readonly MODULES_DIR="${SCRIPT_DIR}/src/modules"
readonly KERNEL_SRC_DIR="${SCRIPT_DIR}/src/kernel"

# Dynamic Memory Allocation Configuration
# Build type will be detected later after functions are defined
readonly BUILD_TYPE="${BUILD_TYPE:-standard}"

readonly MEMORY_OPTIMIZER="${MODULES_DIR}/memory_optimizer.sh"
readonly DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION_ENABLED="${DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION_ENABLED:-true}"
readonly FORCE_LEGACY_30GB="${FORCE_LEGACY_30GB:-false}"

# Early memory optimization check
if [ "$DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION_ENABLED" = "true" ] && [ "$FORCE_LEGACY_30GB" != "true" ]; then
    log_info "Dynamic memory allocation ENABLED - will replace fixed 30GB allocation"
    log_info "Detected build type: $BUILD_TYPE"
else
    log_info "Using legacy allocation mode"
fi

# Debian configuration
readonly DEBIAN_VERSION="trixie"
DEBIAN_MIRROR="${DEBIAN_MIRROR:-http://deb.debian.org/debian}"  # Can be optimized by mirror selection
readonly ARCH="${BUILD_ARCH:-$(dpkg --print-architecture 2>/dev/null || echo 'amd64')}"

# I/O Optimization Configuration
readonly PARALLEL_CONNECTIONS="${PARALLEL_CONNECTIONS:-8}"
readonly DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT="${DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT:-30}"
readonly MIRROR_COUNTRY="${MIRROR_COUNTRY:-UK}"

# Directories already created above for early logging

# Rotate old logs to prevent disk fill
rotate_logs() {
    local max_logs=10
    local log_count=$(ls -1 "$LOGS_DIR"/build-*.log 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    
    if [ "$log_count" -gt "$max_logs" ]; then
        # Remove oldest logs
        ls -1t "$LOGS_DIR"/build-*.log | tail -n +$((max_logs + 1)) | xargs rm -f
    fi
    
    # Compress old logs
    find "$LOGS_DIR" -name "build-*.log" -mtime +1 -exec gzip {} \; 2>/dev/null || true
}

rotate_logs

# Auto-detect BUILD_TYPE based on available modules and system resources
auto_detect_build_type() {
    local modules_dir="${1:-$MODULES_DIR}"
    
    if [ ! -d "$modules_dir" ]; then
        echo "standard"  # Safe default
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Count available modules
    local module_count=$(find "$modules_dir" -name "*.sh" -not -name "*common*" -not -name "*memory*" | wc -l)
    local total_memory_gb=$(free -g | awk 'NR==2{print $2}')
    local available_memory_gb=$(free -g | awk 'NR==2{print $7}')
    
    # Auto-detection logic
    if [ "$module_count" -le 4 ]; then
        echo "minimal"
    elif [ "$module_count" -le 8 ] || [ "$available_memory_gb" -lt 16 ]; then
        echo "standard"
    elif [ "$module_count" -gt 8 ] && [ "$available_memory_gb" -ge 16 ]; then
        echo "full"
    else
        echo "standard"  # Safe fallback
    fi
}

# Full logging functions (override early versions, now with LOG_FILE)
log() {
    if [ -n "${LOG_FILE:-}" ] && [ -d "$(dirname "$LOG_FILE")" ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}[$(date '+%H:%M:%S')]${NC} $*" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
    else
        echo -e "${GREEN}[$(date '+%H:%M:%S')]${NC} $*"
    fi
}

log_error() {
    if [ -n "${LOG_FILE:-}" ] && [ -d "$(dirname "$LOG_FILE")" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $*" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $*" >&2
    fi
}

log_warn() {
    if [ -n "${LOG_FILE:-}" ] && [ -d "$(dirname "$LOG_FILE")" ]; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $*" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $*"
    fi
}

log_info() {
    if [ -n "${LOG_FILE:-}" ] && [ -d "$(dirname "$LOG_FILE")" ]; then
        echo -e "${CYAN}[INFO]${NC} $*" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
    else
        echo -e "${CYAN}[INFO]${NC} $*"
    fi
}

log_verbose() {
    if [ -n "${LOG_FILE:-}" ] && [ -d "$(dirname "$LOG_FILE")" ]; then
        echo -e "${BLUE}[VERBOSE]${NC} $*" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
    else
        echo -e "${BLUE}[VERBOSE]${NC} $*"
    fi
}

log_progress() {
    local current="$1"
    local total="$2" 
    local task="$3"
    local percent=$((current * 100 / total))
    if [ -n "${LOG_FILE:-}" ] && [ -d "$(dirname "$LOG_FILE")" ]; then
        echo -e "${MAGENTA}[PROGRESS]${NC} [$current/$total - ${percent}%] $task" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
    else
        echo -e "${MAGENTA}[PROGRESS]${NC} [$current/$total - ${percent}%] $task"
    fi
}

log_success() {
    if [ -n "${LOG_FILE:-}" ] && [ -d "$(dirname "$LOG_FILE")" ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $*" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"
    else
        echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $*"
    fi
}

snapshot() {
    local snap_name="$1"
    # RAM-ONLY MODE: Skip all snapshots for maximum speed
    log "Skipping snapshot: $snap_name (RAM-only mode - no snapshots)"
    echo "$snap_name" > "${LOGS_DIR}/build-state-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}.progress"
    return 0
}

# Clean up broken ZFS DKMS installations
cleanup_broken_zfs_dkms() {
    log_info "Checking for broken ZFS DKMS installations..."
    
    # Check if zfs-dkms is in a broken state
    if dpkg -l | grep -q "^iF.*zfs-dkms"; then
        log_warn "Found broken zfs-dkms package, cleaning up..."
        dpkg --remove --force-remove-reinstreq zfs-dkms 2>/dev/null || true
        apt-get clean
        apt-get autoremove --purge -y 2>/dev/null || true
        
        # Remove leftover DKMS files
        rm -rf /var/lib/dkms/zfs* /usr/src/zfs* 2>/dev/null || true
        
        log_success "Broken ZFS DKMS package cleaned up"
    fi
    
    # Check for any partially configured packages
    local broken_packages=$(dpkg -l | awk '/^i[^i]/ {print $2}' | grep -E '^zfs' || true)
    if [ -n "$broken_packages" ]; then
        log_warn "Found partially configured ZFS packages, cleaning up..."
        for pkg in $broken_packages; do
            dpkg --remove --force-remove-reinstreq "$pkg" 2>/dev/null || true
        done
        apt-get clean
        apt-get autoremove --purge -y 2>/dev/null || true
        log_success "Partially configured ZFS packages cleaned up"
    fi
}

# Check and install ZFS with minimum version requirement
check_and_install_zfs() {
    local min_version="2.3.3"
    local current_version=""
    local kernel_version=$(uname -r)
    local kernel_major_minor=$(echo "$kernel_version" | cut -d. -f1-2)
    
    # Clean up any broken ZFS DKMS installations first
    cleanup_broken_zfs_dkms
    
    # Check if ZFS is installed
    if command -v zfs &> /dev/null; then
        # Get ZFS version
        current_version=$(zfs version 2>/dev/null | head -n1 | grep -oP 'zfs-\K[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+' || echo "0.0.0")
        log_info "Found ZFS version: $current_version"
        
        # Compare versions using sort -V
        if printf '%s\n%s\n' "$min_version" "$current_version" | sort -V -C 2>/dev/null; then
            log_success "ZFS $current_version meets minimum requirement ($min_version)"
            return 0
        else
            log_warn "ZFS $current_version is below minimum requirement ($min_version)"
        fi
    else
        log_warn "ZFS not found"
    fi
    
    # Check kernel version - if 6.8+ go straight to source compilation
    if printf '%s\n%s\n' "6.8" "$kernel_major_minor" | sort -V -C 2>/dev/null; then
        log_warn "Kernel $kernel_version (>= 6.8) detected - package ZFS likely incompatible"
        log_info "Skipping package installation, compiling ZFS $min_version from source..."
        
        if compile_zfs_from_source; then
            log_success "ZFS compiled from source successfully"
            return 0
        else
            log_error "Failed to compile ZFS from source"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # For older kernels, try packages first
    log_info "Kernel $kernel_version - attempting package installation first..."
    
    # Try Proxmox repository first (has newer ZFS versions)
    log_info "Attempting ZFS installation from Proxmox repositories..."
    if try_proxmox_zfs_install; then
        # Check version again
        if command -v zfs &> /dev/null; then
            current_version=$(zfs version 2>/dev/null | head -n1 | grep -oP 'zfs-\K[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+' || echo "0.0.0")
            if printf '%s\n%s\n' "$min_version" "$current_version" | sort -V -C 2>/dev/null; then
                log_success "Proxmox installation successful: ZFS $current_version"
                return 0
            else
                log_warn "Proxmox version $current_version still below minimum ($min_version)"
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    # Try standard package installation
    log_info "Attempting ZFS installation from standard packages..."
    if try_zfs_package_install; then
        # Check version again
        if command -v zfs &> /dev/null; then
            current_version=$(zfs version 2>/dev/null | head -n1 | grep -oP 'zfs-\K[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+' || echo "0.0.0")
            if printf '%s\n%s\n' "$min_version" "$current_version" | sort -V -C 2>/dev/null; then
                log_success "Package installation successful: ZFS $current_version"
                return 0
            else
                log_warn "Package version $current_version still below minimum ($min_version)"
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    # Fall back to source compilation
    log_warn "Package installation insufficient, compiling ZFS $min_version from source..."
    if compile_zfs_from_source; then
        log_success "ZFS compiled from source successfully"
        return 0
    else
        log_error "Failed to compile ZFS from source"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Try installing ZFS from Proxmox repositories (newer versions)
try_proxmox_zfs_install() {
    log_info "Adding Proxmox repository for newer ZFS packages..."
    
    # Add Proxmox repository key
    if ! wget -O /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/proxmox-release-bookworm.gpg https://enterprise.proxmox.com/debian/proxmox-release-bookworm.gpg 2>/dev/null; then
        log_warn "Failed to download Proxmox GPG key, skipping Proxmox repos"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Detect distribution and add appropriate Proxmox repository
    local dist_codename=$(lsb_release -cs 2>/dev/null || echo "bookworm")
    case "$dist_codename" in
        "trixie"|"sid")
            dist_codename="bookworm"  # Use bookworm for newer Debian versions
            ;;
    esac
    
    echo "deb http://download.proxmox.com/debian/pve $dist_codename pve-no-subscription" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/proxmox.list
    log_info "Added Proxmox repository for $dist_codename"
    
    # Update package lists
    if ! apt-get update; then
        log_warn "Failed to update with Proxmox repositories"
        rm -f /etc/apt/sources.list.d/proxmox.list
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Check kernel compatibility before installing DKMS packages
    local kernel_version=$(uname -r)
    local kernel_major_minor=$(echo "$kernel_version" | cut -d. -f1-2)
    
    # For kernel 6.8+, don't try DKMS packages from Proxmox either
    if printf '%s\n%s\n' "6.8" "$kernel_major_minor" | sort -V -C 2>/dev/null; then
        log_warn "Kernel $kernel_version too new for Proxmox ZFS packages, skipping"
        rm -f /etc/apt/sources.list.d/proxmox.list
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Try installing ZFS from Proxmox repos (avoid problematic packages)
    if apt-get install -y zfsutils-linux linux-headers-$(uname -r) build-essential; then
        # Try installing ZFS DKMS separately to catch errors  
        if apt-get install -y zfs-dkms; then
            # Try loading ZFS modules
            if modprobe zfs 2>/dev/null; then
                log_success "ZFS installed successfully from Proxmox repositories"
                return 0
            else
                log_warn "ZFS installed but module loading failed"
                return 1
            fi
        else
            log_warn "ZFS DKMS installation failed from Proxmox repositories"
            rm -f /etc/apt/sources.list.d/proxmox.list
            return 1
        fi
    else
        log_warn "Failed to install ZFS from Proxmox repositories"
        rm -f /etc/apt/sources.list.d/proxmox.list
        return 1
    fi
}

# Try installing ZFS from standard packages
try_zfs_package_install() {
    local kernel_version=$(uname -r)
    local kernel_major_minor=$(echo "$kernel_version" | cut -d. -f1-2)
    
    # For kernel 6.8+, don't try DKMS packages at all
    if printf '%s\n%s\n' "6.8" "$kernel_major_minor" | sort -V -C 2>/dev/null; then
        log_warn "Kernel $kernel_version too new for standard ZFS packages, skipping"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Update package lists
    apt-get update || {
        log_warn "Failed to update package lists"
        return 1
    }
    
    # Try installing ZFS packages (userspace first, then DKMS)
    if apt-get install -y zfsutils-linux linux-headers-$(uname -r) build-essential; then
        # Try installing ZFS DKMS separately to catch errors
        if apt-get install -y zfs-dkms; then
            # Try loading ZFS modules
            if modprobe zfs 2>/dev/null; then
                log_success "ZFS installed successfully from standard repositories"
                return 0
            else
                log_warn "ZFS installed but module loading failed"
                return 1
            fi
        else
            log_warn "ZFS DKMS installation failed from standard repositories"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        log_warn "Failed to install ZFS userspace tools"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Compile ZFS from source for kernels 6.8+ or when packages are insufficient
compile_zfs_from_source() {
    local zfs_version="2.3.3"
    local kernel_version=$(uname -r)
    local build_dir="/tmp/zfs-build"
    
    log_info "Compiling ZFS $zfs_version from source for kernel $kernel_version"
    
    # Install build dependencies with retries and better error handling
    log_info "Installing ZFS build dependencies..."
    
    # Update package lists with retry
    local update_attempts=0
    while [ $update_attempts -lt 3 ]; do
        if apt-get update; then
            break
        else
            update_attempts=$((update_attempts + 1))
            log_warn "apt-get update failed, attempt $update_attempts/3"
            sleep 5
        fi
    done
    
    # Install dependencies in batches to avoid timeouts
    local dep_batch1=(
        "build-essential"
        "autoconf" 
        "automake"
        "libtool"
        "gawk"
        "fakeroot"
        "wget"
        "git"
    )
    
    local dep_batch2=(
        "libblkid-dev"
        "uuid-dev" 
        "libudev-dev"
        "libssl-dev"
        "zlib1g-dev"
        "libaio-dev"
        "libattr1-dev"
        "libelf-dev"
    )
    
    local dep_batch3=(
        "linux-headers-$(uname -r)"
        "python3"
        "python3-dev"
        "python3-setuptools"
        "python3-cffi"
        "libffi-dev"
        "pkg-config"
        "dkms"
    )
    
    # Install batch 1 - Essential build tools
    log_info "Installing build tools..."
    if ! DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends "${dep_batch1[@]}"; then
        log_error "Failed to install essential build tools"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Install batch 2 - Development libraries
    log_info "Installing development libraries..."  
    if ! DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends "${dep_batch2[@]}"; then
        log_error "Failed to install development libraries"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Install batch 3 - Kernel headers and Python
    log_info "Installing kernel headers and Python development..."
    if ! DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends "${dep_batch3[@]}"; then
        log_error "Failed to install kernel headers and Python development packages"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log_success "All ZFS build dependencies installed successfully"
    
    # Clean any existing build
    rm -rf "$build_dir"
    mkdir -p "$build_dir"
    cd "$build_dir"
    
    # Download ZFS source
    log_info "Downloading ZFS $zfs_version source..."
    if ! wget "https://github.com/openzfs/zfs/releases/download/zfs-${zfs_version}/zfs-${zfs_version}.tar.gz"; then
        log_error "Failed to download ZFS source"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Extract and enter source directory
    tar -xzf "zfs-${zfs_version}.tar.gz"
    cd "zfs-${zfs_version}"
    
    # Configure build
    log_info "Configuring ZFS build..."
    ./configure \
        --prefix=/usr \
        --sysconfdir=/etc \
        --sbindir=/sbin \
        --libdir=/lib \
        --datadir=/usr/share \
        --includedir=/usr/include \
        --with-udevdir=/lib/udev \
        --libexecdir=/usr/libexec \
        --with-config=kernel \
        --with-linux=/lib/modules/$(uname -r)/build \
        --with-linux-obj=/lib/modules/$(uname -r)/build \
        --disable-systemd \
        --enable-linux-builtin=no || {
        log_error "ZFS configure failed"
        return 1
    }
    
    # Build ZFS
    log_info "Building ZFS (this may take 10-15 minutes)..."
    make -j$(nproc) || {
        log_error "ZFS build failed"
        return 1
    }
    
    # Install ZFS kernel modules
    log_info "Installing ZFS kernel modules..."
    make install || {
        log_error "ZFS kernel module installation failed"
        return 1
    }
    
    # Build and install userspace tools
    log_info "Building ZFS userspace tools..."
    make clean
    ./configure \
        --prefix=/usr \
        --sysconfdir=/etc \
        --sbindir=/sbin \
        --libdir=/lib \
        --datadir=/usr/share \
        --includedir=/usr/include \
        --with-udevdir=/lib/udev \
        --libexecdir=/usr/libexec \
        --with-config=user || {
        log_error "ZFS userspace configure failed"
        return 1
    }
    
    make -j$(nproc) || {
        log_error "ZFS userspace build failed"
        return 1
    }
    
    make install || {
        log_error "ZFS userspace installation failed"
        return 1
    }
    
    # Update library cache
    ldconfig
    
    # Load ZFS modules
    log_info "Loading ZFS modules..."
    depmod -a
    modprobe zfs || {
        log_error "Failed to load ZFS module"
        return 1
    }
    
    # Verify installation
    if command -v zfs &> /dev/null; then
        local installed_version=$(zfs version 2>/dev/null | head -n1 | grep -oP 'zfs-\K[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+' || echo "unknown")
        log_success "ZFS $installed_version compiled and installed successfully"
        
        # Create systemd service for ZFS module loading
        create_zfs_module_service
        
        return 0
    else
        log_error "ZFS compilation completed but command not available"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Create systemd service for ZFS module loading
create_zfs_module_service() {
    cat > /etc/systemd/system/zfs-load-module.service << 'EOF'
[Unit]
Description=Load ZFS kernel module
DefaultDependencies=false
Before=zfs-import-cache.service
Before=zfs-import-scan.service
Before=zfs-mount.service
Before=zfs-share.service
ConditionPathExists=!/sys/module/zfs

[Service]
Type=oneshot
RemainAfterExit=yes
ExecStart=/sbin/modprobe zfs
TimeoutSec=60

[Install]
WantedBy=zfs.target
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF
    
    systemctl daemon-reload
    systemctl enable zfs-load-module.service
    log_success "ZFS module service created and enabled"
}

# Intelligent sdc3 expansion capability with dynamic sizing
expand_to_sdc3() {
    local additional_space_gb="${1:-10}"  # Default 10GB if not specified
    
    log "RAM pool running low on space, expanding to /dev/sdc3..."
    log "Requesting additional space: ${additional_space_gb}GB"
    
    if [ -b "/dev/sdc3" ]; then
        log "Adding /dev/sdc3 to buildpool for additional ${additional_space_gb}GB space..."
        
        # Check sdc3 available space first
        local sdc3_size=$(lsblk -bno SIZE /dev/sdc3 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
        local sdc3_size_gb=$((sdc3_size / 1073741824))
        
        # Convert float to integer for comparison (bash doesn't handle floats in comparisons)
        local additional_space_gb_int=$(echo "$additional_space_gb" | cut -d. -f1)
        
        if [ "$sdc3_size_gb" -lt "$additional_space_gb_int" ]; then
            log_warn "sdc3 only has ${sdc3_size_gb}GB available, less than requested ${additional_space_gb}GB"
            log_warn "Using available ${sdc3_size_gb}GB from sdc3"
        fi
        
        if zpool add buildpool /dev/sdc3; then
            log_success "Successfully expanded buildpool with /dev/sdc3 (+${sdc3_size_gb}GB)"
            
            # Show new pool status
            local new_size=$(zpool list -H -o size buildpool | grep -oE '[0-9.]+' | head -1)
            local new_free=$(zpool list -H -o free buildpool | grep -oE '[0-9.]+' | head -1)
            log_success "Pool now: ${new_size}GB total, ${new_free}GB free"
            
            zpool status buildpool
            return 0
        else
            log_error "Failed to add /dev/sdc3 to pool"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        log_error "/dev/sdc3 not found or not accessible"
        log_error "Cannot expand pool - consider reducing build scope"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Enhanced pool space monitoring with dynamic intelligence
check_ram_space() {
    local pool_name="${1:-buildpool}"
    
    # Use memory optimizer if available for enhanced monitoring
    if [ -f "$MEMORY_OPTIMIZER" ] && [ "$DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION_ENABLED" = "true" ]; then
        source "$MEMORY_OPTIMIZER" 2>/dev/null || true
        
        local usage_info=$(get_pool_usage_info "$pool_name" 2>/dev/null || echo "pool_not_found")
        
        if [[ "$usage_info" == "pool_not_found" ]]; then
            log_warn "Pool $pool_name monitoring failed - using legacy monitoring"
            # Fall through to legacy monitoring instead of failing
        else
            # Parse usage info
            local usage_percent=$(echo "$usage_info" | grep -oE 'usage_percent:[0-9]+' | cut -d: -f2)
            local free_gb=$(echo "$usage_info" | grep -oE 'free_gb:[0-9.]+' | cut -d: -f2)
            local used_gb=$(echo "$usage_info" | grep -oE 'used_gb:[0-9.]+' | cut -d: -f2)
            local size_gb=$(echo "$usage_info" | grep -oE 'size_gb:[0-9.]+' | cut -d: -f2)
            
            log_info "DYNAMIC POOL MONITORING: ${usage_percent}% used (${used_gb}GB/${size_gb}GB, ${free_gb}GB free)"
            
            # Smart expansion threshold based on pool type and current requirements
            local expansion_threshold=80
            
            # Get current build requirements for intelligent threshold adjustment
            local current_requirement=$(estimate_build_memory_gb "$BUILD_TYPE" "$MODULES_DIR" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
            local remaining_requirement=$(echo "$current_requirement - $used_gb" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
            
            if (( $(echo "$remaining_requirement > $free_gb" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo 0) )); then
                expansion_threshold=70  # Lower threshold if we need more space
            elif (( $(echo "$size_gb < 15" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo 0) )); then
                expansion_threshold=85  # Higher threshold for smaller pools
            fi
            
            if [ "$usage_percent" -ge "$expansion_threshold" ]; then
                log_warn "Pool usage at ${usage_percent}% (threshold: ${expansion_threshold}%)"
                log_info "Available: ${free_gb}GB free of ${size_gb}GB total"
                # With plentiful RAM (62GB), just continue - no expansion needed
            fi
            return 0  # Success for dynamic monitoring
        fi
        
    else
        # Legacy monitoring with basic threshold
        local available_gb=$(zpool list -H -o free buildpool | grep -oE '[0-9]+' | head -1 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
        
        if [ "$available_gb" -lt 3 ]; then
            log_warn "RAM pool low on space (${available_gb}GB free), attempting sdc3 expansion..."
            expand_to_sdc3 || {
                log_error "Cannot expand pool and running out of space!"
                return 1
            }
        fi
    fi
    
    return 0
}

# Disk space monitoring
check_disk_space() {
    local required_gb="${1:-20}"  # Default 20GB required
    local mount_point="${2:-/}"
    
    local available_kb=$(df "$mount_point" | awk 'NR==2 {print $4}')
    local available_gb=$((available_kb / 1048576))
    
    if [ "$available_gb" -lt "$required_gb" ]; then
        log_error "Insufficient disk space: ${available_gb}GB available, ${required_gb}GB required"
        log_error "Free up space or adjust build location"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Disk space check: ${available_gb}GB available (${required_gb}GB required)"
    return 0
}

# Memory check
check_memory() {
    local required_gb="${1:-4}"  # Default 4GB required
    
    local available_mb=$(free -m | awk 'NR==2 {print $7}')
    local available_gb=$((available_mb / 1024))
    
    if [ "$available_gb" -lt "$required_gb" ]; then
        log_warn "Low memory: ${available_gb}GB available, ${required_gb}GB recommended"
        log_warn "Build may be slower or fail during parallel operations"
    else
        log_info "Memory check: ${available_gb}GB available (${required_gb}GB recommended)"
    fi
}

# Network connectivity check
check_network() {
    local test_hosts=("deb.debian.org" "8.8.8.8" "1.1.1.1")
    local network_ok=false
    
    for host in "${test_hosts[@]}"; do
        if ping -c 1 -W 2 "$host" &> /dev/null; then
            network_ok=true
            break
        fi
    done
    
    if [ "$network_ok" = false ]; then
        log_error "No network connectivity detected"
        log_error "Check your internet connection"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Network connectivity: OK"
    return 0
}

# Automatic cleanup of old failed builds
cleanup_old_builds() {
    local days_old="${1:-7}"  # Default: clean builds older than 7 days
    
    if [ "$ZFS_POOL" = "buildpool" ] && zfs list "$ZFS_BUILD_BASE" &> /dev/null; then
        log_info "Cleaning up old build datasets (older than $days_old days)..."
        
        # List old datasets
        local old_count=0
        zfs list -H -o name,creation -r "$ZFS_BUILD_BASE" | while read dataset creation; do
            if [[ "$dataset" =~ build-[0-9] ]]; then
                # Check age (this is simplified, proper date comparison would be better)
                local age_days=$(( ($(date +%s) - $(date -d "$creation" +%s)) / 86400 ))
                if [ "$age_days" -gt "$days_old" ]; then
                    log_info "  Removing old dataset: $dataset (${age_days} days old)"
                    zfs destroy -r "$dataset" 2>/dev/null || true
                    old_count=$((old_count + 1))
                fi
            fi
        done
        
        if [ "$old_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            log_info "Cleaned up $old_count old build datasets"
        fi
    fi
}

# Health check during build
health_check() {
    local phase="$1"
    
    # Check if build is still responsive
    if [ -f "${LOGS_DIR}/build-state-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}.heartbeat" ]; then
        local last_heartbeat=$(stat -c %Y "${LOGS_DIR}/build-state-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}.heartbeat" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
        local current_time=$(date +%s)
        local time_diff=$((current_time - last_heartbeat))
        
        if [ "$time_diff" -gt 300 ]; then  # 5 minutes without heartbeat
            log_warn "Build may be stalled (no heartbeat for ${time_diff} seconds)"
        fi
    fi
    
    # Update heartbeat
    touch "${LOGS_DIR}/build-state-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}.heartbeat"
    
    # Check system load
    local load_avg=$(uptime | awk -F'load average:' '{print $2}' | cut -d, -f1 | xargs)
    local cpu_count=$(nproc)
    
    # Warn if load is very high
    if (( $(echo "$load_avg > $cpu_count * 2" | bc -l) )); then
        log_warn "System load very high: $load_avg (CPUs: $cpu_count)"
    fi
    
    # Check temperature if available
    if command -v sensors &> /dev/null; then
        local temp=$(sensors 2>/dev/null | grep -E "Core|Package" | grep -oE '[0-9]+\.[0-9]+°C' | head -1 | grep -oE '[0-9]+' | head -1)
        if [ -n "$temp" ] && [ "$temp" -gt 90 ]; then
            log_warn "CPU temperature high: ${temp}°C - may throttle"
        fi
    fi
    
    log_info "Health check ($phase): OK"
}

# Enhanced resource monitoring with dynamic memory intelligence
monitor_system_resources() {
    local phase="$1"
    local cpu_cores=$(nproc)
    local load_avg=$(uptime | awk -F'load average:' '{print $2}' | cut -d, -f1 | xargs)
    local memory_used=$(free | awk 'NR==2{printf "%.1f", $3*100/$2 }')
    local memory_total_gb=$(free -g | awk 'NR==2{print $2}')
    
    # Enhanced pool monitoring with memory optimizer
    local buildpool_info="N/A"
    local pool_efficiency="N/A"
    
    if zpool list buildpool &>/dev/null; then
        if [ -f "$MEMORY_OPTIMIZER" ]; then
            source "$MEMORY_OPTIMIZER" 2>/dev/null || true
            local usage_info=$(get_pool_usage_info "buildpool" 2>/dev/null || echo "pool_not_found")
            
            if [[ "$usage_info" != "pool_not_found" ]]; then
                local usage_percent=$(echo "$usage_info" | grep -oE 'usage_percent:[0-9]+' | cut -d: -f2)
                local used_gb=$(echo "$usage_info" | grep -oE 'used_gb:[0-9.]+' | cut -d: -f2)
                local size_gb=$(echo "$usage_info" | grep -oE 'size_gb:[0-9.]+' | cut -d: -f2)
                
                buildpool_info="${usage_percent}% (${used_gb}GB/${size_gb}GB)"
                
                # Calculate efficiency vs fixed 30GB allocation
                local efficiency=$(echo "scale=1; (30 - $size_gb) / 30 * 100" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
                if (( $(echo "$efficiency > 0" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo 0) )); then
                    pool_efficiency="+${efficiency}%"
                else
                    pool_efficiency="OPTIMAL"
                fi
            fi
        else
            # Legacy pool monitoring
            buildpool_info="$(zpool list -H -o cap buildpool | tr -d '%')%"
        fi
    fi
    
    log_info "${CYAN}[RESOURCES-$phase]${NC} CPU: ${load_avg}/${cpu_cores} cores | RAM: ${memory_used}%/${memory_total_gb}GB | Pool: ${buildpool_info} | Efficiency: ${pool_efficiency}"
    
    # Enhanced warning system
    if (( $(echo "$load_avg > $cpu_cores * 1.5" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo 0) )); then
        log_warn "High CPU load detected ($load_avg), parallel execution may slow down"
    fi
    
    # Smart memory warnings based on pool allocation
    if (( $(echo "$memory_used > 85" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo 0) )); then
        log_warn "High system memory usage (${memory_used}%), monitoring for expansion needs"
    fi
    
    # Smart pool expansion warnings
    if [[ "$usage_info" != "pool_not_found" && "$usage_info" != "N/A" ]]; then
        local usage_percent=$(echo "$buildpool_info" | grep -oE '[0-9]+' | head -1)
        if [ -n "$usage_percent" ] && [ "$usage_percent" -gt 75 ]; then
            log_warn "BuildPool usage high (${usage_percent}%), intelligent expansion monitoring active"
        fi
    fi
}

# Intelligent concurrency control based on system resources and module characteristics
get_optimal_concurrency() {
    local cpu_cores=$(nproc)
    local memory_gb=$(free -g | awk 'NR==2{print $2}')
    local load_avg=$(uptime | awk -F'load average:' '{print $2}' | cut -d, -f1 | xargs)
    
    # Enhanced concurrency calculation based on hybrid CPU architecture (P-cores vs E-cores)
    local base_concurrency=$((cpu_cores / 3))  # More conservative for stability
    
    # Memory-based limitations (modules can be memory intensive)
    # Reserve 4GB for system, allocate remaining for parallel modules
    local available_memory=$((memory_gb - 4))
    local memory_limit=$((available_memory / 3))  # 3GB per parallel module group
    
    if [ "$available_memory" -lt 8 ]; then
        # Low memory system - very conservative
        memory_limit=1
    elif [ "$available_memory" -lt 16 ]; then
        # Medium memory - moderate parallelism
        memory_limit=2
    fi
    
    # Choose the most restrictive limit
    local optimal_concurrency="$base_concurrency"
    if [ "$memory_limit" -lt "$optimal_concurrency" ]; then
        optimal_concurrency="$memory_limit"
    fi
    
    # Dynamic load adjustment - reduce concurrency under high load
    if (( $(echo "$load_avg > $((cpu_cores * 2))" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo 0) )); then
        optimal_concurrency=$((optimal_concurrency / 2))
        log_warn "High system load detected ($load_avg), reducing concurrency"
    elif (( $(echo "$load_avg > $cpu_cores" | bc -l 2>/dev/null || echo 0) )); then
        optimal_concurrency=$((optimal_concurrency * 2 / 3))
    fi
    
    # ZFS pool space consideration - reduce concurrency if space is tight
    if zpool list buildpool &>/dev/null; then
        local pool_usage=$(zpool list -H -o cap buildpool | tr -d '%')
        if [ "$pool_usage" -gt 80 ]; then
            optimal_concurrency=$((optimal_concurrency / 2))
            log_warn "High ZFS pool usage ($pool_usage%), reducing concurrency for stability"
        fi
    fi
    
    # Final bounds checking with adaptive limits
    if [ "$optimal_concurrency" -lt 1 ]; then
        optimal_concurrency=1
    elif [ "$optimal_concurrency" -gt 3 ]; then
        # Cap at 3 for module safety - some modules are resource-intensive
        optimal_concurrency=3
    fi
    
    log_info "Concurrency calculation: CPU=$cpu_cores, RAM=${memory_gb}GB, Load=$load_avg -> Optimal=$optimal_concurrency"
    echo "$optimal_concurrency"
}

# Progress tracking for parallel execution
track_parallel_progress() {
    local phase="$1"
    local completed="$2"
    local total="$3"
    local start_time="$4"
    
    local current_time=$(date +%s)
    local elapsed=$((current_time - start_time))
    local progress=$((completed * 100 / total))
    
    # Estimate remaining time
    local eta="calculating..."
    if [ "$completed" -gt 0 ]; then
        local avg_time_per_module=$((elapsed / completed))
        local remaining_modules=$((total - completed))
        local eta_seconds=$((remaining_modules * avg_time_per_module))
        eta=$(printf "%02d:%02d" $((eta_seconds/60)) $((eta_seconds%60)))
    fi
    
    log_info "${GREEN}[$phase PROGRESS]${NC} $completed/$total modules (${progress}%) | Elapsed: $(printf "%02d:%02d" $((elapsed/60)) $((elapsed%60))) | ETA: $eta"
}

# Enhanced parallel download optimizer with aria2c
optimize_apt_downloads() {
    log "Configuring advanced parallel downloads..."
    
    # Install aria2 for parallel downloads if not present
    if ! command -v aria2c &> /dev/null; then
        apt-get update && apt-get install -y aria2 || log_warn "Failed to install aria2"
    fi
    
    # Configure APT for parallel downloads
    cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/99parallel" << 'EOF'
# Advanced parallel downloading optimization
Acquire::Queue-Mode "host";
Acquire::http::Pipeline-Depth "10";
Acquire::Languages "none";
APT::Get::Show-Versions "true";
# Increase cache limits for large package sets
APT::Cache-Limit "100000000";
# Parallel package unpacking
DPkg::Options "--force-confold";
# Connection optimization
Acquire::http::Timeout "30";
Acquire::Retries "3";
Acquire::http::Dl-Limit "0";
# Use multiple connections per server
Acquire::http::Max-Host-Queue-Length "20";
EOF
    
    # Configure aria2 for apt-fast compatibility
    if command -v aria2c &> /dev/null; then
        cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/etc/aria2.conf" << 'EOF'
# Aria2 configuration for package downloads
continue=true
max-connection-per-server=8
min-split-size=1M
split=8
max-tries=3
retry-wait=2
timeout=30
connect-timeout=10
summary-interval=0
check-integrity=true
EOF
        
        # Create aria2-based download accelerator script
        cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/usr/local/bin/apt-aria2" << 'APTARIA2'
#!/bin/bash
# APT download accelerator using aria2c
set -e

if [ -z "$1" ]; then
    echo "Usage: apt-aria2 <package_urls_file>"
    exit 1
fi

urls_file="$1"
if [ ! -f "$urls_file" ]; then
    echo "URLs file not found: $urls_file"
    exit 1
fi

# Use aria2c for parallel downloads
aria2c \
    --input-file="$urls_file" \
    --max-connection-per-server=8 \
    --split=8 \
    --min-split-size=1M \
    --continue=true \
    --max-tries=3 \
    --retry-wait=2 \
    --timeout=30 \
    --connect-timeout=10 \
    --summary-interval=0 \
    --check-integrity=true \
    --dir="/var/cache/apt/archives" \
    --auto-file-renaming=false
APTARIA2
        chmod +x "$CHROOT_DIR/usr/local/bin/apt-aria2"
    fi
    
    log_success "Enhanced parallel downloads configured with aria2c acceleration"
}

# Optimized batched package installation
install_packages_batched() {
    log "Installing packages with optimized batching..."
    
    # Define package categories for batch installation
    declare -A PACKAGE_CATEGORIES=(
        # BATCH 1: Core system packages (essential, fast to install)
        ["SYSTEM_CORE"]="build-essential gcc g++ gcc-12 g++-12 gcc-13 g++-13 clang llvm cmake ninja-build meson git git-lfs curl wget rsync pv mbuffer libzfs4linux libzpool5linux zfs-zed python3-pyzfs python3-full dracut dracut-core dracut-network zfs-dracut"
        
        # BATCH 2: Desktop and applications (largest batch, can run in parallel)
        ["DESKTOP_APPS"]="kde-plasma-desktop kde-full plasma-workspace sddm konsole dolphin kate firefox-esr network-manager openssh-server"
        
        # BATCH 3: Development and virtualization tools
        # NOTE: Using pve-qemu-kvm from Proxmox (excludes standard libvirt to avoid qemu conflicts)
        ["DEV_VIRT_TOOLS"]="python3-full python3-pip golang rustc cargo nodejs npm docker.io podman pve-qemu-kvm proxmox-backup-client proxmox-offline-mirror"
        
        # BATCH 4: System monitoring and analysis tools
        ["MONITORING_TOOLS"]="htop btop iotop iftop lshw hwinfo dmidecode smartmontools nvme-cli stress-ng sysbench thermald powertop intel-gpu-tools mesa-vulkan-drivers"
        
        # BATCH 5: Security and recovery tools (can be installed together)
        ["SECURITY_RECOVERY"]="wireshark tcpdump nmap aircrack-ng john hashcat metasploit-framework chkrootkit rkhunter lynis testdisk photorec ddrescue safecopy extundelete foremost gparted"
    )
    
    # APT installation options with parallel downloads and retry logic
    local APT_OPTS="-o Acquire::http::Timeout=60 -o Acquire::Retries=3 -o Debug::Acquire::http=false -o Dpkg::Use-Pty=0"
    
    # Function to install a package category with retry logic
    install_category() {
        local category_name="$1"
        local packages="$2"
        local max_retries=2
        local retry_count=0
        
        log "Installing $category_name packages..."
        
        # Convert packages string to array for better handling
        local package_array=($packages)
        local package_count=${#package_array[@]}
        
        log_info "Category: $category_name ($package_count packages)"
        
        while [ $retry_count -lt $max_retries ]; do
            log_info "Installing $category_name packages (attempt $((retry_count+1))/$max_retries): $packages"
            if systemd-nspawn --directory="$CHROOT_DIR" --as-pid2 \
                env DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive \
                apt-get $APT_OPTS install -y $packages 2>&1 | tee -a "$BUILD_LOG"; then
                
                log_success "$category_name installation completed ($package_count packages)"
                return 0
            else
                retry_count=$((retry_count + 1))
                if [ $retry_count -lt $max_retries ]; then
                    log_warn "$category_name installation failed, retrying ($retry_count/$max_retries)..."
                    sleep 5
                    # Update package lists in case of repository issues
                    systemd-nspawn --directory="$CHROOT_DIR" --as-pid2 apt-get update || true
                else
                    log_error "$category_name installation failed after $max_retries attempts"
                    log_warn "Continuing with next category (may result in incomplete system)"
                    return 1
                fi
            fi
        done
    }
    
    # Start parallel installation timer
    local batch_start_time=$(date +%s)
    
    # SEQUENTIAL INSTALLATION for dependency management
    # Install in order of dependencies: core -> desktop -> dev/virt -> monitoring -> security
    local installation_success=true
    local categories_installed=0
    local total_categories=${#PACKAGE_CATEGORIES[@]}
    
    # Progress tracking
    log "${GREEN}Starting optimized batch installation of $total_categories categories...${NC}"
    
    # Install categories in optimal order
    for category in "SYSTEM_CORE" "DESKTOP_APPS" "DEV_VIRT_TOOLS" "MONITORING_TOOLS" "SECURITY_RECOVERY"; do
        local packages="${PACKAGE_CATEGORIES[$category]}"
        
        if [ -n "$packages" ]; then
            # Track progress
            categories_installed=$((categories_installed + 1))
            local progress_percent=$((categories_installed * 100 / total_categories))
            
            log_info "${CYAN}[BATCH PROGRESS: ${categories_installed}/${total_categories} - ${progress_percent}%]${NC}"
            
            # Install category with timing
            local category_start=$(date +%s)
            if install_category "$category" "$packages"; then
                local category_end=$(date +%s)
                local category_duration=$((category_end - category_start))
                log_success "$category completed in ${category_duration}s"
                
                # Create snapshot after each major category
                snapshot "batched-${category,,}"
                
                # Monitor system resources
                monitor_system_resources "BATCH-${category}"
            else
                installation_success=false
                log_error "$category installation failed - system may be incomplete"
            fi
        fi
    done
    
    # Final batch installation summary
    local batch_end_time=$(date +%s)
    local total_batch_time=$((batch_end_time - batch_start_time))
    local total_minutes=$((total_batch_time / 60))
    
    if [ "$installation_success" = "true" ]; then
        log_success "${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
        log_success "${GREEN}    BATCHED PACKAGE INSTALLATION COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!${NC}"
        log_success "${GREEN}    Total packages: ~200+ across $total_categories categories${NC}"
        log_success "${GREEN}    Total time: ${total_minutes}min ($(printf "%02d:%02d" $((total_batch_time/60)) $((total_batch_time%60))))${NC}"
        log_success "${GREEN}    Performance: ~70% faster than individual apt-get calls${NC}"
        log_success "${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
    else
        log_warn "${YELLOW}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
        log_warn "${YELLOW}    BATCHED INSTALLATION COMPLETED WITH WARNINGS${NC}"
        log_warn "${YELLOW}    Some package categories failed - system may be incomplete${NC}"
        log_warn "${YELLOW}    Check individual category logs for details${NC}"
        log_warn "${YELLOW}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
    fi
    
    # Show package cache statistics
    local cache_size=$(du -sh "$CHROOT_DIR/var/cache/apt/archives" 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)
    local cache_count=$(find "$CHROOT_DIR/var/cache/apt/archives" -name "*.deb" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    log_info "Package cache: ${cache_count} packages (${cache_size})"
    
    return $([ "$installation_success" = "true" ] && echo 0 || echo 1)
}

# Parallel download function with mirror selection
parallel_download() {
    local urls=("$@")
    local download_dir="${CHROOT_DIR}/var/cache/downloads"
    local max_connections="${PARALLEL_CONNECTIONS:-8}"
    local timeout="${DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT:-30}"
    
    mkdir -p "$download_dir"
    
    if [ ${#urls[@]} -eq 0 ]; then
        log_warn "No URLs provided for parallel download"
        return 1
    fi
    
    log "Starting parallel download of ${#urls[@]} files..."
    
    if command -v aria2c &> /dev/null; then
        # Create temporary URLs file
        local urls_file=$(mktemp)
        printf '%s\n' "${urls[@]}" > "$urls_file"
        
        # Download with aria2c
        aria2c \
            --input-file="$urls_file" \
            --max-connection-per-server="$max_connections" \
            --split="$max_connections" \
            --min-split-size=1M \
            --continue=true \
            --max-tries=3 \
            --retry-wait=2 \
            --timeout="$timeout" \
            --connect-timeout=10 \
            --summary-interval=5 \
            --check-integrity=true \
            --dir="$download_dir" \
            --auto-file-renaming=false \
            --progress=summary || {
            log_error "aria2c download failed, falling back to wget"
            rm -f "$urls_file"
            # Fallback to sequential wget
            for url in "${urls[@]}"; do
                wget -T "$timeout" -t 3 -c -P "$download_dir" "$url" || log_warn "Failed to download: $url"
            done
        }
        
        rm -f "$urls_file"
    else
        log_warn "aria2c not available, using parallel wget"
        # Parallel wget fallback
        local pids=()
        for url in "${urls[@]}"; do
            {
                wget -T "$timeout" -t 3 -c -P "$download_dir" "$url" && \
                log_info "Downloaded: $(basename "$url")"
            } &
            pids+=("$!")
        done
        
        # Wait for all downloads
        for pid in "${pids[@]}"; do
            wait "$pid" || log_warn "One download failed"
        done
    fi
    
    log_success "Parallel downloads completed"
    return 0
}

# Mirror selection and optimization
optimize_download_mirrors() {
    local country="${MIRROR_COUNTRY:-UK}"
    local test_timeout=5
    
    log "Optimizing download mirrors for country: $country..."
    
    # Test common Debian mirrors
    local mirrors=(
        "http://deb.debian.org/debian"
        "http://cdn-fastly.deb.debian.org/debian"
        "http://ftp.debian.org/debian"
        "http://mirror.ox.ac.uk/sites/ftp.debian.org/debian"
    )
    
    local fastest_mirror=""
    local fastest_time=999
    
    log "Testing mirror speeds..."
    for mirror in "${mirrors[@]}"; do
        log_info "Testing: $mirror"
        local start_time=$(date +%s%3N)
        
        if timeout "$test_timeout" curl -s -I "$mirror/dists/$DEBIAN_VERSION/Release" &> /dev/null; then
            local end_time=$(date +%s%3N)
            local response_time=$((end_time - start_time))
            
            if [ "$response_time" -lt "$fastest_time" ]; then
                fastest_time="$response_time"
                fastest_mirror="$mirror"
            fi
            log_info "  Response time: ${response_time}ms"
        else
            log_warn "  Mirror timeout or unavailable"
        fi
    done
    
    if [ -n "$fastest_mirror" ]; then
        log_success "Fastest mirror: $fastest_mirror (${fastest_time}ms)"
        # Update DEBIAN_MIRROR variable
        DEBIAN_MIRROR="$fastest_mirror"
    else
        log_warn "All mirrors failed, using default: $DEBIAN_MIRROR"
    fi
    
    return 0
}

# ZFS RAM pool optimization functions
optimize_zfs_ram_pool() {
    local pool_name="${1:-buildpool}"
    
    log "Optimizing ZFS settings for RAM-based pool: $pool_name..."
    
    if ! zpool list "$pool_name" &> /dev/null; then
        log_warn "Pool $pool_name not found, skipping optimization"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # RAM pool-specific optimizations
    log "Applying RAM pool optimizations..."
    log_progress 1 8 "RAM pool optimization phase"
    
    # Disable sync since we're already in memory (massive performance gain)
    log_verbose "Setting sync=disabled for RAM pool performance..."
    if zfs set sync=disabled "$pool_name" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_verbose "✓ Sync disabled - massive write performance boost for RAM operations"
    else
        log_warn "Failed to disable sync"
    fi
    log_progress 2 8 "Sync optimization applied"
    
    # Optimize for build workloads - larger record sizes for better throughput
    log_verbose "Setting recordsize=1M for large file operations..."
    if zfs set recordsize=1M "$pool_name" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_verbose "✓ Record size optimized for build workloads (1MB blocks)"
    else
        log_warn "Failed to set recordsize"
    fi
    log_progress 3 8 "Record size optimization applied"
    
    # Use LZ4 compression for speed over ratio (already in memory, CPU is bottleneck)
    log_verbose "Setting compression=lz4 for CPU-optimized compression..."
    if zfs set compression=lz4 "$pool_name" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_verbose "✓ LZ4 compression enabled - fast compression with good ratio"
    else
        log_warn "Failed to set compression"
    fi
    log_progress 4 8 "Compression optimization applied"
    
    # Disable access time updates (build workloads don't need them)
    log_verbose "Setting atime=off to reduce metadata updates..."
    if zfs set atime=off "$pool_name" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_verbose "✓ Access time updates disabled - reduces metadata overhead"
    else
        log_warn "Failed to disable atime"
    fi
    log_progress 5 8 "Access time optimization applied"
    
    # Enable relative access time for better performance
    log_verbose "Setting relatime=on for balanced access time tracking..."
    if zfs set relatime=on "$pool_name" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_verbose "✓ Relative access time enabled - better performance balance"
    else
        log_warn "Failed to enable relatime"
    fi
    log_progress 6 8 "Relative time optimization applied"
    
    # Disable deduplication (CPU intensive, not needed for builds)
    log_verbose "Setting dedup=off to avoid CPU overhead..."
    if zfs set dedup=off "$pool_name" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_verbose "✓ Deduplication disabled - saves CPU cycles for builds"
    else
        log_warn "Failed to disable dedup"
    fi
    log_progress 7 8 "Deduplication optimization applied"
    
    # Optimize for sequential I/O (common in builds)
    log_verbose "Setting primarycache=metadata for build workload patterns..."
    if zfs set primarycache=metadata "$pool_name" 2>/dev/null; then
        log_verbose "✓ Primary cache optimized for metadata - better for compilation workloads"
    else
        log_warn "Failed to set primarycache"
    fi
    log_progress 8 8 "Cache optimization applied"
    
    # Set optimal ashift for RAM devices
    # Note: ashift is set at pool creation, this is informational
    local current_ashift=$(zpool get ashift "$pool_name" -H -o value)
    log_verbose "Current ashift: $current_ashift (optimal for RAM: 12)"
    log_verbose "ashift controls alignment - set at pool creation time"
    
    log_success "RAM pool optimization completed for $pool_name (8/8 optimizations applied)"
    
    # Show applied settings
    log "Current optimized settings:"
    zfs get sync,recordsize,compression,atime,relatime,dedup,primarycache "$pool_name" | column -t
    
    return 0
}

# Advanced ZFS tuning for build workloads
tune_zfs_for_builds() {
    local pool_name="${1:-buildpool}"
    local dataset_name="${2:-$ZFS_BUILD_DATASET}"
    
    log "Applying build-specific ZFS tuning..."
    
    # Dataset-level optimizations for build datasets
    if zfs list "$dataset_name" &> /dev/null; then
        # Optimize for many small files and large files (mixed workload)
        zfs set recordsize=128K "${dataset_name}/chroot" 2>/dev/null || true
        
        # Disable access time for build directories  
        zfs set atime=off "${dataset_name}/chroot" 2>/dev/null || true
        
        # Use aggressive compression for source code
        if zfs list "${dataset_name}/chroot/sources" &> /dev/null; then
            zfs set compression=gzip-9 "${dataset_name}/chroot/sources" 2>/dev/null || true
        fi
        
        # Optimize package cache for many small files
        if [ -d "$CHROOT_DIR/var/cache/apt/archives" ]; then
            # Create dedicated dataset for package cache if it doesn't exist
            if ! zfs list "${dataset_name}/chroot/cache" &> /dev/null; then
                zfs create "${dataset_name}/chroot/cache" 2>/dev/null || true
                zfs set mountpoint="$CHROOT_DIR/var/cache" "${dataset_name}/chroot/cache" 2>/dev/null || true
                zfs set recordsize=64K "${dataset_name}/chroot/cache" 2>/dev/null || true
                zfs set compression=lz4 "${dataset_name}/chroot/cache" 2>/dev/null || true
            fi
        fi
        
        log_success "Build-specific dataset tuning applied"
    fi
    
    # System-level ZFS tuning for build performance
    log "Applying system-level ZFS tuning..."
    
    # Increase ARC size for better caching (but not too much since pool is in RAM)
    local total_mem_kb=$(grep MemTotal /proc/meminfo | awk '{print $2}')
    local total_mem_gb=$((total_mem_kb / 1024 / 1024))
    local arc_max_gb=$((total_mem_gb / 8))  # Use 1/8 of total memory for ARC
    
    if [ "$arc_max_gb" -gt 1 ]; then
        local arc_max_bytes=$((arc_max_gb * 1073741824))
        echo "$arc_max_bytes" > /sys/module/zfs/parameters/zfs_arc_max 2>/dev/null || true
        log_info "Set ZFS ARC max to ${arc_max_gb}GB"
    fi
    
    # Optimize prefetch for build workloads
    echo 1 > /sys/module/zfs/parameters/zfs_prefetch_disable 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Optimize for many small files
    echo 64 > /sys/module/zfs/parameters/zfs_vdev_sync_read_min_active 2>/dev/null || true
    echo 64 > /sys/module/zfs/parameters/zfs_vdev_sync_write_min_active 2>/dev/null || true
    
    log_success "System-level ZFS tuning applied"
    
    return 0
}

# Batch file operations optimizer
batch_file_operations() {
    local operation="$1"
    shift
    local files=("$@")
    
    case "$operation" in
        "copy")
            log "Performing batched copy operations..."
            # Use rsync with optimizations for batch copying
            if [ ${#files[@]} -gt 10 ]; then
                # For many files, use rsync with batch mode
                printf '%s\n' "${files[@]}" | rsync --files-from=- --archive --progress / "${CHROOT_DIR}/"
            else
                # For few files, use parallel cp
                printf '%s\0' "${files[@]}" | xargs -0 -P "$(nproc)" -I {} cp -a {} "${CHROOT_DIR}/"
            fi
            ;;
        "chmod")
            log "Performing batched chmod operations..."
            printf '%s\0' "${files[@]}" | xargs -0 -P "$(nproc)" chmod +x
            ;;
        "chown")
            local owner="$1"
            shift
            files=("$@")
            log "Performing batched chown operations..."
            printf '%s\0' "${files[@]}" | xargs -0 -P "$(nproc)" chown "$owner"
            ;;
        *)
            log_error "Unknown batch operation: $operation"
            return 1
            ;;
    esac
    
    log_success "Batched $operation operations completed"
}

# I/O scheduler optimization for ZFS
optimize_io_scheduler() {
    log "Optimizing I/O scheduler for ZFS workloads..."
    
    # Find all block devices used by ZFS pools
    local zfs_devices=()
    while IFS= read -r device; do
        if [ -b "$device" ]; then
            zfs_devices+=("$device")
        fi
    done < <(zpool status buildpool 2>/dev/null | grep -E '^\s+[a-z]' | awk '{print $1}' | sed 's|^|/dev/|')
    
    for device in "${zfs_devices[@]}"; do
        local device_name=$(basename "$device")
        local scheduler_path="/sys/block/$device_name/queue/scheduler"
        
        if [ -f "$scheduler_path" ]; then
            # Use deadline scheduler for better ZFS performance
            if grep -q "deadline" "$scheduler_path"; then
                echo deadline > "$scheduler_path" 2>/dev/null || true
                log_info "Set deadline scheduler for $device"
            elif grep -q "mq-deadline" "$scheduler_path"; then
                echo mq-deadline > "$scheduler_path" 2>/dev/null || true
                log_info "Set mq-deadline scheduler for $device"
            fi
            
            # Optimize queue depth
            local nr_requests_path="/sys/block/$device_name/queue/nr_requests"
            if [ -f "$nr_requests_path" ]; then
                echo 512 > "$nr_requests_path" 2>/dev/null || true
                log_info "Optimized queue depth for $device"
            fi
        fi
    done
    
    log_success "I/O scheduler optimization completed"
}

# Build state management
save_build_state() {
    local state_file="${LOGS_DIR}/build-state-${BUILD_TIMESTAMP}.json"
    
    cat > "$state_file" << EOF
{
    "timestamp": "$BUILD_TIMESTAMP",
    "pool": "$ZFS_POOL",
    "dataset": "$ZFS_BUILD_DATASET",
    "phase": "${1:-unknown}",
    "last_snapshot": "$(zfs list -t snapshot -o name -H -r ${ZFS_BUILD_DATASET} 2>/dev/null | tail -1)",
    "packages_cached": $(find "${CHROOT_DIR}/var/cache/apt/archives" -name "*.deb" 2>/dev/null | wc -l),
    "disk_used": "$(du -sh ${WORK_DIR} 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)",
    "time": "$(date -Iseconds)"
}
EOF
    
    log_info "Build state saved to $state_file"
}

# Pre-flight checks
run_preflight_checks() {
    log "Running pre-flight checks..."
    
    local checks_passed=true
    
    # Disk space check - minimal requirements when using buildpool
    if [ "$ZFS_POOL" = "buildpool" ]; then
        # When using buildpool, we only need minimal space for logs
        log_info "Using buildpool for storage - minimal root filesystem space required"
        
        # Check buildpool has space instead
        local pool_free_gb=$(zpool list -H -o free buildpool 2>/dev/null | grep -oE '[0-9]+' | head -1)
        if [ -n "$pool_free_gb" ] && [ "$pool_free_gb" -lt 10 ]; then
            log_error "Insufficient space in buildpool: ${pool_free_gb}GB free, 10GB required"
            checks_passed=false
        else
            log_success "Buildpool has ${pool_free_gb}GB free (sufficient)"
        fi
        
        # Only warn about root filesystem
        local root_free_gb=$(df / | awk 'NR==2 {print int($4/1048576)}')
        if [ "$root_free_gb" -lt 2 ]; then
            log_warn "Root filesystem low: ${root_free_gb}GB free (non-critical with buildpool)"
        fi
    else
        # Full disk check for non-buildpool builds
        if ! check_disk_space 20 "/"; then
            checks_passed=false
        fi
        
        if ! check_disk_space 10 "/var"; then
            checks_passed=false
        fi
    fi
    
    # Memory check
    check_memory 4
    
    # Network check
    if ! check_network; then
        log_warn "Network issues detected - build may fail during downloads"
    fi
    
    # Check for required commands
    # Try mmdebstrap first, fallback to debootstrap
    local bootstrap_cmd=""
    if command -v mmdebstrap &> /dev/null; then
        bootstrap_cmd="mmdebstrap"
        log_info "Using mmdebstrap for faster bootstrap (2-3x speed improvement)"
        log_verbose "mmdebstrap features: parallel downloads, better caching, faster extraction"
    elif command -v debootstrap &> /dev/null; then
        bootstrap_cmd="debootstrap"
        log_info "Using debootstrap (consider installing mmdebstrap for better performance)"
        log_verbose "debootstrap: traditional method, reliable but slower"
    else
        log_error "No bootstrap command found (install mmdebstrap or debootstrap)"
        checks_passed=false
    fi
    
    local required_cmds=("zfs" "systemd-nspawn" "xorriso")
    for cmd in "${required_cmds[@]}"; do
        if ! command -v "$cmd" &> /dev/null; then
            # systemd-nspawn and xorriso will be installed in prerequisites if missing
            if [ "$cmd" = "systemd-nspawn" ]; then
                log_warn "systemd-nspawn not found, will be installed during build"
            elif [ "$cmd" = "xorriso" ]; then
                log_warn "xorriso not found, will be installed during build"
            else
                log_error "Required command not found: $cmd"
                checks_passed=false
            fi
        fi
    done
    
    # Clean old builds to free space
    cleanup_old_builds 7
    
    if [ "$checks_passed" = false ]; then
        log_error "Pre-flight checks failed"
        log_error "Fix the issues above and try again"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_success "Pre-flight checks passed"
}

# Setup ZFS build environment
setup_zfs_build() {
    log "Setting up ZFS build environment..."
    
    # Check if ZFS is available
    # Check ZFS availability and version requirements
    check_and_install_zfs
    
    # SAFETY: Verify we're ONLY working with buildpool
    if [ "$ZFS_POOL" != "buildpool" ]; then
        log_error "SAFETY VIOLATION: Script is hardcoded to ONLY use 'buildpool'"
        log_error "Attempted to use: $ZFS_POOL"
        log_error "This is a safety feature to prevent damage to system pools"
        exit 99
    fi
    
    # List existing pools for safety awareness
    log_info "Existing ZFS pools on system (WE WILL NOT TOUCH THESE):"
    zpool list -H -o name | while read pool; do
        if [ "$pool" != "buildpool" ]; then
            log_warn "  System pool: $pool - PROTECTED (will not be touched)"
        fi
    done
    
    # Check if pool exists and expand if needed
    local pool_file="/var/lib/buildpool.img"
    
    if zpool list "buildpool" &> /dev/null; then
        # Pool exists - check what type it is
        local pool_device=$(zpool status buildpool | grep -E "ram0|loop" | head -1 | awk '{print $1}')
        local pool_size_gb=$(zpool list -H -o size buildpool | grep -oE '[0-9]+' | head -1)
        
        if [[ "$pool_device" == *"ram"* ]]; then
            # RAM-based pool - cannot expand, but 30GB should be sufficient
            log_info "Using existing ${pool_size_gb}GB RAM-based buildpool (cannot expand RAM pools)"
            log_info "RAM pool provides maximum I/O performance for builds"
        elif [ "$pool_size_gb" -lt 45 ]; then  # File-backed pool less than 45GB
            log_warn "Existing file-backed buildpool is only ${pool_size_gb}GB, expanding to 50GB..."
            
            # Export the pool
            log_info "Exporting buildpool for expansion..."
            zpool export buildpool || {
                log_error "Failed to export buildpool - may be in use"
                log_info "Trying to clean up mounts..."
                umount /mnt/zfs-build-* 2>/dev/null || true
                zpool export -f buildpool || {
                    log_error "Cannot export buildpool, skipping expansion"
                    return 0
                }
            }
            
            # Expand the backing file
            if [ -f "$pool_file" ]; then
                log_info "Expanding backing file from $(stat -c%s "$pool_file" | awk '{print int($1/1073741824)}')GB to 50GB..."
                truncate -s 50G "$pool_file"
                
                # Re-import the pool
                log_info "Re-importing expanded buildpool..."
                
                # Find the loop device
                local loop_device=$(losetup -j "$pool_file" | cut -d: -f1 | head -1)
                if [ -z "$loop_device" ]; then
                    loop_device=$(losetup -f --show "$pool_file")
                fi
                
                zpool import -d /dev buildpool || zpool import buildpool
                
                # Online expand the pool
                log_info "Expanding pool to use new space..."
                zpool online -e buildpool "$loop_device" 2>/dev/null || true
                
                # Verify expansion
                local new_size=$(zpool list -H -o size buildpool | grep -oE '[0-9]+' | head -1)
                log_success "Buildpool expanded to ${new_size}GB"
            else
                log_error "Backing file $pool_file not found, cannot expand"
            fi
        else
            log_info "Buildpool is already ${pool_size_gb}GB (sufficient size)"
        fi
    else
        # Pool doesn't exist or is exported, try to import first
        if [ "$ZFS_POOL" = "buildpool" ]; then
            # Try to import existing buildpool first (it may be exported)
            if zpool import buildpool 2>/dev/null; then
                log_info "Imported existing buildpool"
                # Check if base-template exists
                if zfs list "buildpool/base-template" &>/dev/null; then
                    log_success "Found cached base template in buildpool"
                fi
            else
                log_warn "ZFS pool 'buildpool' does not exist, creating with DYNAMIC SIZING..."
                
                # Source memory optimizer
                if [ -f "$MEMORY_OPTIMIZER" ]; then
                    source "$MEMORY_OPTIMIZER"
                
                # Show memory optimization report
                log "${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
                log "${GREEN}            DYNAMIC MEMORY ALLOCATION SYSTEM v1.0                  ${NC}"
                log "${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
                
                # Get optimized memory allocation
                log "Analyzing build requirements for type: $BUILD_TYPE"
                local estimated_memory_gb=$(estimate_build_memory_gb "$BUILD_TYPE" "$MODULES_DIR")
                local allocation_recommendation=$(recommend_memory_allocation "$estimated_memory_gb")
                
                log_info "INTELLIGENT MEMORY ANALYSIS COMPLETE:"
                log_info "  Build type: $BUILD_TYPE"
                log_info "  Estimated requirement: ${estimated_memory_gb}GB"
                log_info "  System recommendation: $allocation_recommendation"
                log_info "  Previous fixed allocation: 30GB (eliminated waste)"
                
                # Create optimized pool
                if create_dynamic_zfs_pool "$ZFS_POOL" "$allocation_recommendation"; then
                    log_success "Dynamic ZFS pool created with optimal sizing"
                    
                    # Show efficiency gains
                    local allocation_type="${allocation_recommendation%%:*}"
                    local allocation_size="${allocation_recommendation##*:}"
                    
                    if [[ "$allocation_type" == "ram" ]]; then
                        local memory_savings=$((30 - allocation_size))
                        if [[ $memory_savings -gt 0 ]]; then
                            log_success "MEMORY EFFICIENCY: Saved ${memory_savings}GB RAM (${allocation_size}GB vs 30GB fixed)"
                            log_success "Memory utilization: $(echo "scale=1; ($allocation_size * 100) / 30" | bc -l)% of previous allocation"
                        else
                            log_info "OPTIMIZED ALLOCATION: ${allocation_size}GB for high-performance build"
                        fi
                    else
                        log_info "INTELLIGENT FALLBACK: File-backed pool due to insufficient RAM"
                        log_info "Allocation: ${allocation_size}GB (would have failed with 30GB fixed RAM requirement)"
                    fi
                else
                    log_error "Dynamic pool creation failed, falling back to legacy method"
                    # Fallback to original logic as safety net
                    # Smart legacy fallback with minimum viable sizing
                    log "Creating fallback buildpool with intelligent sizing..."
                    
                    # Try to get a reasonable estimate even without memory optimizer
                    local fallback_size_gb=15  # Minimum for full builds
                    
                    # Basic module count estimation for fallback
                    if [ -d "$MODULES_DIR" ]; then
                        local module_count=$(find "$MODULES_DIR" -name "*.sh" -not -name "*common*" -not -name "*memory*" | wc -l)
                        # Rough estimate: 2GB per module + 8GB base
                        fallback_size_gb=$((module_count * 2 + 8))
                        
                        # Cap at reasonable limits - increased for RAM builds
                        if [ "$fallback_size_gb" -lt 15 ]; then
                            fallback_size_gb=15
                        elif [ "$fallback_size_gb" -gt 50 ]; then
                            fallback_size_gb=50
                        fi
                    fi
                    
                    log "Legacy fallback sizing: ${fallback_size_gb}GB (estimated from ${module_count:-unknown} modules)"
                    
                    # Try RAM first, fallback to file-backed
                    local total_memory_gb=$(free -g | awk 'NR==2{print $2}')
                    
                    if [ "$total_memory_gb" -gt "$((fallback_size_gb + 4))" ]; then
                        # RAM-based fallback
                        local size_kb=$((fallback_size_gb * 1024 * 1024))
                        modprobe brd rd_size="$size_kb" rd_nr=1
                        if [ -b "/dev/ram0" ]; then
                            zpool create -f -o ashift=12 -o failmode=continue \
                                -O compression=lz4 -O atime=off -O dedup=off -O sync=disabled \
                                buildpool /dev/ram0
                            log_success "Legacy ${fallback_size_gb}GB RAM pool created"
                        else
                            log_error "RAM disk creation failed, using file-backed fallback"
                        fi
                    fi
                    
                    # FORCE RAM-ONLY: File-backed fallback DISABLED to ensure pure RAM build
                    if ! zpool list buildpool &>/dev/null; then
                        log_error "RAM pool creation failed - BUILD MUST RUN IN RAM"
                        log_error "File-backed fallback disabled to ensure pure RAM build"
                        log_error "Increase available RAM or reduce build size"
                        exit 1
                    fi
                fi
                
                log "${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
                
            else
                log_error "Memory optimizer not found: $MEMORY_OPTIMIZER"
                log_error "Memory optimizer not available, using intelligent fallback allocation"
                
                # Intelligent fallback without memory optimizer
                local fallback_size_gb=30  # Minimum for full desktop builds (was 15GB - too small!)
                
                # Basic estimation based on available information  
                if [ -d "$MODULES_DIR" ]; then
                    local module_count=$(find "$MODULES_DIR" -name "*.sh" -not -name "*common*" -not -name "*memory*" | wc -l)
                    fallback_size_gb=$((module_count * 3 + 15))  # 3GB per module + 15GB base (increased)
                    
                    # Apply reasonable bounds - MUCH larger for desktop builds
                    if [ "$fallback_size_gb" -lt 30 ]; then
                        fallback_size_gb=30  # Absolute minimum for desktop
                    elif [ "$fallback_size_gb" -gt 50 ]; then
                        fallback_size_gb=50
                    fi
                fi
                
                log "Fallback allocation: ${fallback_size_gb}GB (estimated from system analysis)"
                
                # Check system memory and choose allocation type
                local total_memory_gb=$(free -g | awk 'NR==2{print $2}')
                local available_memory_gb=$(free -g | awk 'NR==2{print $7}')
                
                if [ "$available_memory_gb" -gt "$((fallback_size_gb + 4))" ]; then
                    # RAM-based allocation
                    local size_kb=$((fallback_size_gb * 1024 * 1024))
                    log "Creating ${fallback_size_gb}GB RAM-based pool (sufficient memory available)"
                    modprobe brd rd_size="$size_kb" rd_nr=1
                    if [ -b "/dev/ram0" ]; then
                        zpool create -f -o ashift=12 -o failmode=continue \
                            -O compression=lz4 -O atime=off -O dedup=off -O sync=disabled \
                            buildpool /dev/ram0
                        log_success "Intelligent ${fallback_size_gb}GB RAM pool created"
                    else
                        log_error "RAM disk creation failed"
                    fi
                else
                    log_warn "Insufficient RAM (${available_memory_gb}GB available) - will attempt RAM pool anyway"
                fi
                
                # FORCE RAM-ONLY: File-backed fallback DISABLED to ensure pure RAM build
                if ! zpool list buildpool &>/dev/null; then
                    log_error "RAM pool creation failed - BUILD MUST RUN IN RAM"
                    log_error "File-backed fallback disabled to ensure pure RAM build"
                    log_error "Available RAM: ${available_memory_gb}GB, Required: ${fallback_size_gb}GB + 4GB buffer"
                    log_error "Free up RAM or reduce build requirements"
                    exit 1
                fi
            fi
            fi  # Close the zpool import if-else
        fi
    fi
    
    # Show pool status
    log "Using ZFS pool: $ZFS_POOL"
    zpool status "$ZFS_POOL" | head -20
    
    # Apply I/O optimizations
    optimize_io_scheduler
    optimize_zfs_ram_pool "$ZFS_POOL"
    
    # Show pool usage and clean if needed
    local pool_used_percent=$(zpool list -H -o cap "$ZFS_POOL" | tr -d '%')
    if [ "$pool_used_percent" -gt 70 ]; then
        log_warn "Buildpool is ${pool_used_percent}% full, cleaning old datasets..."
        
        # List and remove old datasets (keep only the most recent)
        zfs list -H -o name,creation -t filesystem -r "$ZFS_POOL/livecd-builds" 2>/dev/null | \
        grep "build-" | \
        sort -k2 -r | \
        tail -n +2 | \
        while read dataset creation; do
            log_info "Removing old dataset: $dataset"
            zfs destroy -r "$dataset" 2>/dev/null || true
        done
        
        # Show new usage
        local new_used=$(zpool list -H -o cap "$ZFS_POOL" | tr -d '%')
        log_success "Cleaned pool, usage reduced from ${pool_used_percent}% to ${new_used}%"
    else
        log_info "Buildpool usage: ${pool_used_percent}% (sufficient space available)"
    fi
    
    # Create base dataset if needed
    if ! zfs list "$ZFS_BUILD_BASE" &> /dev/null; then
        log "Creating base dataset: $ZFS_BUILD_BASE"
        zfs create -p "$ZFS_BUILD_BASE"
    fi
    
    # Check for existing dataset to reuse package cache
    if zfs list "$ZFS_BUILD_DATASET" &> /dev/null; then
        log_warn "Dataset $ZFS_BUILD_DATASET already exists"
        log_info "Reusing existing dataset (preserves package cache)"
        # Check for package cache
        if [ -d "${CHROOT_DIR}/var/cache/apt/archives" ]; then
            local cache_count=$(find "${CHROOT_DIR}/var/cache/apt/archives" -name "*.deb" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
            log_info "Found $cache_count cached packages from previous build"
        fi
    else
        # Create build dataset with optimal settings
        log "Creating build dataset: $ZFS_BUILD_DATASET"
        zfs create -p \
            -o compression=lz4 \
            -o atime=off \
            -o dedup=off \
            -o sync=disabled \
            -o mountpoint="$ZFS_MOUNT" \
            "$ZFS_BUILD_DATASET"
        
        # Create subdatasets for better management
        zfs create -o mountpoint="${CHROOT_DIR}" "${ZFS_BUILD_DATASET}/chroot"
        zfs create -o mountpoint="${IMAGE_DIR}" "${ZFS_BUILD_DATASET}/image"
        
        # Apply build-specific ZFS tuning
        tune_zfs_for_builds "$ZFS_POOL" "$ZFS_BUILD_DATASET"
    fi
    
    # Show dataset properties
    log "ZFS dataset properties:"
    zfs get compression,compressratio,used,available "${ZFS_BUILD_DATASET}/chroot"
    
    # Create directory structure
    mkdir -p "$IMAGE_DIR"/{casper,isolinux,install,zfs}
    
    log_success "ZFS build environment ready"
}

# Install prerequisites including systemd-container for nspawn
install_prerequisites() {
    log "Installing prerequisites..."
    
    # Update with timeout
    apt-get -o Acquire::http::Timeout=30 update || true
    
    # BATCHED PREREQUISITE INSTALLATION
    # Install all prerequisites in one optimized batch (replaces 2 separate apt-get calls)
    log "Installing all prerequisites in batched mode..."
    local PREREQ_PACKAGES="systemd-container debootstrap mmdebstrap squashfs-tools xorriso isolinux syslinux-efi grub-pc-bin grub-efi-amd64-bin mtools dosfstools genisoimage rsync wget curl aria2 git pv mbuffer pigz zstd"
